bug.author: falcondai
bug.description:
The function returns a tensor with rank = 0, 1, 2 depending on its arguments. This is inconsistent with its docstring's description of the return: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/ops/loss.py#L58>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/ops/loss.py#L58</denchmark-link>
I will submit a PR soon to fix the doc. NOTE: Only file GitHub issues for bugs and feature requests. All other topics will be closed. For general support from the community, see <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow>StackOverflow</denchmark-link> . To make bugs and feature requests more easy to find and organize, we close issues that are deemed out of scope for GitHub Issues and point people to StackOverflow. For bugs or installation issues, please provide the following information. The more information you provide, the more easily we will be able to offer help and advice. <denchmark-h:h3>What related GitHub issues or StackOverflow threads have you found by searching the web for your problem?</denchmark-h>
irrelevant <denchmark-h:h3>Environment info</denchmark-h>
Operating System: irrelevant Installed version of CUDA and cuDNN: (please attach the output of ls -l /path/to/cuda/lib/libcud*): If installed from binary pip package, provide:
A link to the pip package you installed: The output from python -c "import tensorflow; print(tensorflow.__version__)".
If installed from source, provide
The commit hash (git rev-parse HEAD) The output of bazel version
<denchmark-h:h3>If possible, provide a minimal reproducible example (We usually don't have time to read hundreds of lines of your code)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>What other attempted solutions have you tried?</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Logs or other output that would be helpful</denchmark-h>
(If logs are large, please upload as attachment or provide link).

comments.comment: Thanks for the help. Please link the PR when you have submitted it.
This looks fixed in master, and it will roll out over time. Thank you! I'm closing this; please reopen if I've missed something.
